ChatGPT_response_0: Heat transfer within solid materials occurs primarily through a process called thermal conduction. This process involves the movement of heat through the material without any actual movement of the material itself. Instead, heat energy is transferred from the warmer parts of an object to the cooler parts by the vibrations and movements of the particles (atoms and molecules) within the solid. As these particles vibrate, they transfer energy to neighboring particles, gradually distributing the heat throughout the material.
